website_summaries.verdict: Although the image quality is just "good enough," the S405 series is still an excellent choice for budget buyers focused on streaming and simplicity.
pros: The TCL S405 series are among the least expensive 4K TVs on the market
Roku TV delivers the simplest, most comprehensive smart TV experience on the market
A superb user interface delivers thousands of apps and the most 4K video of any system
cons: Worse picture than competing Vizio TVs
4K resolution and HDR don't deliver a substantial improvement in image quality

customer_reviews.title: Dead within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved this TV for the 3 months it worked! It was fantastic. Until today. Literally owned this for 3 months and it "popped" and is dead. Now waiting 24-48 hours for customer service to "get back" to me to see what they are going to do. SO DISAPPOINTING.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Tellone

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I ever did was decide to buy this.
customer_reviews.text: After hours of gaming, movies and tv, this is simply the best TV I've ever purchased! I tweaked some settings (which was incredibly easy) and couldn't stop dropping my jaw. Draw distances in games seemed enhanced somehow. The colors... The HDR is so worth it. I can't stress enough how worth it the HDR is. Blows my dang mind, even the TV's speakers are better than expected, bass is noticable. The apps and Roku function very smoothly. I would highly suggest anyone that loves movies or games (or BOTH) to get this TV! Great price for supreme value!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Dorey

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time in a few months you'll wish you didn't buy this brand!
customer_reviews.text: It was great when we first got it but in recent months some of the apps don't load or the force close the tv constantly kicks you out of cable or other input including all apps. Worst TV ever! I bought the protection plan through Amazon and submitted a claim and they told me to contact the manufacturer. GO WITH NAME BRANDS and stick to what you know!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My parents love this, and it makes me incredibly jealous!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV for my parents, they were still on an old 55" CRT projection. This sounded like a good deal. Wow, what an understatement. I didn't realize that it was HDR & 4K! The picture is outstanding and the menu system is really snappy. This eliminated so many wires and remotes for my parents, I now have a pile of electronics I'm not sure what I'm going to do with. My parents are 88 & 80... and they have no problem operating and using the television which is about the biggest endorsement I can give anything!
customer_reviews.author: Stuart I. Rice

customer_reviews.title: HONEST REVIEW
customer_reviews.text: When I turned the tv on for the first time, the remote did not work. The tv was stock on the "Lets get started" page. I called customer support and after 45 minutes of trouble shooting they finally agreed to send me a new remote. I ended up smacking the remote a couple times and it started to work. So no more issues. Overall, the tv looks and sounds great! Yes, it sounds good too! But the company does lack quality control. I am happy with the purchase and would recommend it to you, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R.

customer_reviews.title: Setup For PC Moniter
customer_reviews.text: Im useing this as a PC Monitor with GTX 1070. I love it. 15ms response is really good for a TV. VERY IMPORTANT SETTINGS Turn off HDR in the setting under TV * menu In Nvidia or AMD contol panel Set Ycbcr 444 Turn on game mode In the * Menu. Most importantly go to settings inputs then set it to HDMI 2.0 not auto. Then set your color don't use the default. After you do all this this will really be very impressive. I played with HDR for 2 hours it sucks it also keeps messing up my Chroma 444 setting. After turning it off everything is much more clear and better no more glitches.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Foster

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS TV ..This is a terrible TV , worked fine for 2-3 months ( and I don’t use it daily ) but suddenly the screen died. I called the tech support and they couldn’t help .. they said they can’t fix the problem... spend 200-300 more on a more reliable brand.. this brand is just horrible
customer_reviews.author: Ibrahim el husseini

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine was just a bad one
customer_reviews.text: The panel we got had pretty bad back light bleed from all 4 corners. it made dark movies/shows in a dark room unwatchable. I reached out to TCL with the attached pictures and this was their response. "That's not typical, but all backlit TVs will have this to some extent. It's further exaggerated by being the only light source in a very dark room, and taking a picture of it. This is not something that would be repairable. You can request an exchange from Amazon, which will likely be faster, or we can proceed with swapping it out if you'd like."
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: broken back light LOOOONG wait for shipments
customer_reviews.text: Tv arrived with broken backlight and totally black screen.TV powered and but screen was only barely visible if one shined a flashlight into the screen. Had to pack it up and get picked up (I'm glad we hadn't hung it on the wall yet!). Replacement ship time was in 3+ months! I guess demand is surpassing supply. But where is quality control?
customer_reviews.author: KFH

customer_reviews.title: Hostage TV
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER recommend buying this TV. Had to pay additional to activate it. Even though screen says they don't charge in order for the TV to work you must pay to open an account with Roku. One time fee but if you don't pay you can't watch anything. Really it would have been better to add the fee to price instead of holding the TV hostage. Truly sucks having to pay to be able to make it operational.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: Picture Not Very Good!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this exact TV at a mass merchandiser and thought the picture was great, had what we wanted for features, so I ordered it off Amazon. A week after installing and messing with the picture settings, I have to report the picture on this TV is worse than the picture on my 6 year old 1080p Visio. Very disappointed. I suggest spending more money and buying better quality than the TCL brand. I’m still considering returning the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Just my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: we love this Smart TV
customer_reviews.text: we love this Smart TV!!! it's 4K UHD honestly, there are only very few 4K content worth watching now but it's ready when we need it it's just the right size for viewing on our sofa and we mounted it on a Mount Factory Rolling TV Cart Mobile TV Stand for 40-65 inch Flat Screen, LED, LCD, OLED, Plasma, Curved TV's - Universal Mount with Wheels now, it's rolling where we need it, be it in the living, dining, study or bedroom! very nice quality, IT DOESN'T STRAIN YOUR EYES! that is very important hands down, get this! there is no better price vs quality on any TV models out there!
customer_reviews.author: Coney

customer_reviews.title: 4K resolution with build in Roku at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this TV. I simply love it. The picture is bright and crisp with bright colors and the TV has a 4K resolution. It's great having Roku built in and also have the ability to hook up other boxes like Apple TV, Amazon Firestick, game consoles and DVD players.The sound is very good as well considering that I don't have any external speakers hooked up to the TV. This TV represents a generational improvement over 1080p TVs and with built in Roku, the viewer can decide what apps to install vs. a TV that comes with a predetermined set of apps. The price is right as well. You won't go wrong with this TV!
customer_reviews.author: David A. Ahrens

customer_reviews.title: Awesome entry level 4K TV
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 4K TV and I gotta say having the built in Roku is pretty awesome! I am a big believer in IP TV so this seamlessly worked with Netflix (to get 4K from Netflix you need to pay an extra $2.00 a month), Hulu, HBO Now, and Amazon Video. I haven't tried Crunchyroll yet to see how that experience is. The built in speakers are just okay, so I bought awhich I then connected to the TV using an optical cable.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Bravo TCL and Roko
customer_reviews.text: This is the best TV I have ever had. Beautiful picture with easy to adjust functions. The wireless connection is fast. The remote is simple to use. Push a button to connect to Netflix, Amazon, HBO and Sling. I didn't know about Sling before. It is great because with the second option at $25+/_ a month I get the network channels and I want to watch. I do not have cable anymore as this has replaced it for less $.
customer_reviews.author: eliteimage

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at the quality of this 49" tv. Replaced a name brand and found this picture far superior. FWIW I am very critical of my electronic equipment and if you take the time to set it up properly you will love it. Never used the Roki interface before and must admit it took a couple of days to fully grasp it's peculiarities. No big deal. I am 80 years old and did it; so can you if you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Wm Posey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Brother Reading Any More Reviews, Just BUY This TV
customer_reviews.text: Amazing picture and easy easy easy remote, even wife figured out the remote, haha ..... This is the BEST BANG for your Buck and you’ll love the ease of setup and quality of the picture. We cut the cable cord and now enjoy TV using just our WiFi Signal - Killer Deal as I was paying over $100 month for just TV and now zero dollars although we may subscribe to Sling and already are Amazon Prime Members so that adds some to monthly TV expense but man oh man are we glad we got this TV, Love it! Oh forgot, we have the 65” 2017 Model.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Blacked out after a week.
customer_reviews.text: For every 9 good reviews there's 1 bad review. This gives a 90% success with this TV. I've never imagined I'll be one of the unfortunate 10%. But I have. The TV blacked out after a week. 1 week! We're returning it bcz we have no faith in this product, I'm afraid it will back out again unnoticed. Fixing it each time cost alot of time and effort, it's just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Worst TV ever.
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst TV's i have ever bought. problem after problem. first a huge line in the middle of the TV showed up.Now my TV will not work because of some update that wont go through. so my TV keeps restarting and cant even use it now. The company has very poor customer service. difficult to deal with. save your self the headache and dont buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lind

customer_reviews.title: BEST TV on the market today! 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST smart tv on the market for this price. I am so impressed with this tv and the smart features. It’s EASY, FAST and it WORKS! I have had Samsung and LG TV’s and I regret buying both of those. Both Samsung and LG TVs stopped working for no reason after 2 years. This TV is replacing my broke LG. I just hope this one lasts longer than 2 years, but at the price less than a smartphone it’s hard to just replace it with the most recent tv technology on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Needs a soundbar. But seriously, that's all it needs.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this TV on because we had previously ordered a TCL 42" HD tv and really liked it. Great remote that's super easy to navigate. App controls with your phone. Lots of channels to stream. Picture is wonderful. BUT! Unlike my 42" Tcl HD, the speakers on the TV are horrible. I waited for so long to get this TV I didn't want to send it back for fear of not being able to get another one for months again, so I sucked it up and got a soundbar and that fixed the issue. Didn't really want to go that route, but in the end, way better.
customer_reviews.author: Shelving Man

customer_reviews.title: Horizontal Lines, Defective TV
customer_reviews.text: Within a year of this TV's lifetime, it develops very distracting horizontal lines that will pan up from the bottom of the screen continuously, and affect every available input of the TV. After trying and failing to find solutions online, I've discovered that this appears to be a fairly common defect of this TV and, more often than not, develop some time around or after most customer warranties run out. Speaking frankly, I wish that I had saved my time and money on this cheap Chinese product and simply saved up for a better investment in a pricier, but more established, trust worthy brand.
customer_reviews.author: sherrell a hardin

customer_reviews.title: Great TV but handle with extreme care
customer_reviews.text: Great TV with very decent 4k picture for price. Only complaint is the screen is SO sensitive... Just by taking it out of the box I have permanent pressure marks on the screen. I'm an honest guy so I won't be returning it but TCL needs to think about protective covers or at least make the screen sensitivity much more obvious on the box. Even with due carefulness, it was easily damaged. Lots of money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Dead pixels... no bueno
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tv in February of 2018, it is not April of 2018 and there is a line of dead pixels from top to bottom(see photos). I guess you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: A little background... I cut the cord on cable over a year ago. I currently operate on DSL internet (approx 10mbps) and stream everything through FireStick/FireTV. I do have a Tablo for OTA stations. For my setup, I could not imagine a more perfect television. The remote was of no interest to me. With a little finagling, I was able to program my SideClick remote to perform all necessary functions (adjust volume, Power on/off and switch inputs). The menu for the television is great - allowing you to name all inputs and default which input comes up at power on. Very happy with my purchase. Would and DO recommend this TV to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: Was packaged in a box, then surrounded by jumbo bubble wrap, and placed in another box, so A+ for packaging. The TV arrived in perfect condition. The picture is as vivid and clear (if not better) as my 2016 Samsung 4k tv. You can't beat the simplicity of a built in roku interface. So much less annoying than other smart TV setups. Speakers aren't phenomenal, but sound on the same par as other pricier sets. I recommend a sound bar for any and every TV, though. I will be buying another or two in the future for the guest rooms.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Young

customer_reviews.title: ... now for about 4 months - picture quality is great, it looks great in my media center
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this TV now for about 4 months - picture quality is great, it looks great in my media center, it has a slew of apps, you can download and use the Roku App which also allows remote control of the tv from your mobile device. My boys and I enjoy watching movies, playing video games, and generally spending quality time with the family with our Roku Smart TV. I highly recommend this TV - great value.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: A highly acceptable 4k computer monitor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for an old 4k TV (Seiki) whose HDMI ports gave up. It is a big step up. Blacks are black, subtle contrast is visible, gamma is acceptable, and colors render great. The only critical adjustment is to turn the sharpness down to 20 to get rid of fringing on fine details. Most 4k monitors are small enough that you have to scale up the fonts to work, which cuts into the advantage of the increased resolution. This monitor is big enough that you can leave everything at its native scaling and still use it.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly and Roy

customer_reviews.title: They made it right.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered didn't work right. Trouble-shooting with support at the TV manufacturer didn't work well - TCL is the company. Then I contacted the seller here instead and they sent me a new one and I'm returning the other one at their expense. So far this new one is working well! Beautiful picture. So much easier to set up when the darn thing works. The seller has redeemed themselves in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: B. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Wow !! Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other reviewers we needed a new t.v in a hurry after our old one died so I went to Amazon and searched, read the reviews and came across this model. It arrived extremely quickly and just needed the feet bolted on ( if not using the wall mount ) and you plug it in; super simple. The picture, sound, Roku and 4K for the price is an amazing value. When our other set goes to the great electronics graveyard we will definitely buy another one. A highly recommended purchase. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Car's R Fun

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: The Good: Picture is really nice. Audio is good enough, better than my last Vizio (that needed a sound bar). The built-in Roku OS is fast and quite good. Tons of streaming apps and they work well. The not-so-good: Using the headphones jack disables the tv speakers. So late at night if you want to switchover to headphones, you have to get up and plug in the jack. TCL support confirmed this is an issue. The remote is not back-lit. So until you master it, you're flying in the dark. Overall: For the price, this is a solid TV. 1 star removed for the audio issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Incredible value, great TV
customer_reviews.text: Incredible value! This Smart TV was super easy to connect to our wireless, cable and streaming accounts, and the picture is gorgeous. We use it in the master bedroom, placed 3 feet away from the foot of the bed and it is just the right size. Big enough to see but not so large that is overwhelms the room. I have a Yamaha sound bar but I don't need it, the sound is just fine. I was hesitant to buy such an inexpensive non-name-brand TV but at under $300, I figured I'd give it a try and could give it away if it sucked -- but I was amazed by the quality.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great For Exactly Two Years.....
customer_reviews.text: Not a heavy TV watcher. Worked well out of box. Two years and one month later it began flickering to black. Found online that turning brightness down might help. It did, but at this point left side is significantly darker than right once flickering stopped. Called customer support. They walked us through a series of troubleshooting steps culminating in a factory reset. Left side dimming and flickering came back. Suggested I take it in for repair. Two years is an awful short time span for a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Aperson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Avoid this brand
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a cheap tv. Yes it is 4K and has decent quality. My biggest problem is a scanning bar that slowly rises from the middle to the top of the screen when using HDMI. I was informed it is a problem that cannot be fixed, and it started happening right after the 1 year warranty ended, of course. Also, it isn’t really 120 hz, it is 60 hz using tricks to appear 120 hz. You get what you pay for. This brand is trash and I’ll never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: BeatsMove970

customer_reviews.title: Forget about wireless speakers
customer_reviews.text: Ummmm....really? You can't attach Bluetooth speakers or hook this up through your Echo devices until you have Roku TV speakers hooked up. Unfortunately I can't find the Roku speakers anywhere including the Roku site. It appears that they would theoretically be $179 if you could purchase them but they're not on Amazon or Ebay or anything. Of course you can physically connect a soundbar but there's no way to do wireless speakers with this device as far as I can tell. Obviously just a proprietary trick to make us buy Roku speakers from them but what's the point if you can't buy the speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sell you a defect product, then assign you to product warranty procedure
customer_reviews.text: Received the ordered TV, but not showing the picture. I immediately called the customer support first as indicated in the first page of the user's guide. After spending near an hour diagnostics with their rep apologized sending a defect product and asked me to return for the replacement. Then, spending one more hour with another TCL rep. for the replacement process (the phone line had the bad connection). That second rep was not quite friendly and just assigned me to their product warranty procedure, which really surprised me. Then, with the help of the Amazon's rep, I sent the TV back and got the refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This TV has takes up the same space that my 46" RCA 1080p TV took up. I notice that it throws off a lot less heat so that makes me think it's a lot more efficient. The image quality isn't the best I've seen, but that's to be expected when you compare TVs that have a $1700 price difference. For the price I don't think you'll find a better deal. The remote is super easy to use, great input options (an extra HDMI import compared to my last TV) and digital audio out for Dolby Digital 5.1 surround sound which simplified our entertainment system by providing a single source for anything playing on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Refresh Line Constantly and Definitely not 120hz
customer_reviews.text: The TV worked great for a few months. Then out of nowhere one day this refresh line appeared. It is a horizontal line that slowly crawls up the screen. It's faint but very noticeable. It is especially bad when I am watching anything from and HDMI port in the back. In addition, the TV just simply isn't 120hz. Heck I even doubt the 4k capabilities. I've seen a 4k 120hz and this just doesn't compare. Not to mention the refresh line. Who wants a TV with a huge contrast line crawling up your screen constantly? Bought it on black Friday and felt that it was something TCL just pumped out in super low quality to sell this season.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed!!!!! Almost a year to the date of purchased the tv stopped working. Called Amazon and thanks God I purchased the extended warranty however, the tv is still u see the manufacturer’s warranty. So this problem has happened so often that they order the parts and schedule for the technician to come out to repair the tv. I went back and read some of the reviews and wish I had paid closer attention to the problems experienced with this television. As for me, I’m done with this manufacturer. Amazon should also not be selling this stuff knowing it’s not good.
customer_reviews.author: Wmhenry

customer_reviews.title: Competent TV
customer_reviews.text: Great to have Roku integrated into this TV. "TV" becomes a legacy app just like "phone" became a legacy app on smartphones. I can switch between cable, HBO Go (which is great if you have a second house but don't have access to HBO subscription for your main house). Color/contrast could use some improvement but within this price range the technology used (LED backlit) is never going to give a super quality picture like OLED or QLED or plasma. Overall a competent unit we use for the 2nd house.
customer_reviews.author: ginsing

customer_reviews.title: Get one, and get one now...say, “No” to the boob tube!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a really great TV. I’m pretty happy with it. I wish the HD came in better. Sometimes the YouTube videos also come in with some blurr. I don’t know if that can be controlled with some setting options. Haven’t been able to find that out. Otherwise, I am really thrilled with my TV. It’s life changing. I cannot believe I was satisfied with a 20 year old boob tube for the past few years...a hand-me-down from a relative for what was supposed to be a very short move. I kept saying, “this will do”. Boy have I been missing out for the past 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great tv for the price point. Works well in bright room.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Have had it up and running for a day now. Good screen clarity, nice picture, speakers work perfect for my living room/kitchen. Have been watching football all day and it's been a pleasure. Played FIFA on my PS4 earlier in the day and it looked and performed great.
customer_reviews.author: Ben F.

customer_reviews.title: Best TV I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Got this TV for my 72 year old mother. She is hard to hear so the large text on bottom of display is awesome. The Roku built in is a no brainier for her. She used to never watch Amazon video or Netflix until now. She loves it. I would love to see somebody create a Facebook easy to use interface for web TV for the elderly to use to see the grandkids and use the simplified remote to scroll through the app. One can dream can't they?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Merkel

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value.
customer_reviews.text: I work in the film industry and thus have pretty exacting taste when it comes to A/V equipment. I read a lot of reviews and articles before I bought this back in fall of 2018 and I haven't been disappointed. For the money, this TV blows me away. It honestly competes with displays that are 5x more expensive. The only real drawback of this TV is the speakers but if you plan on getting a stellar experience from your TV speakers then you probably have other problems to deal with. My wife and I also have lots of gaming consoles so I wish it had more HDMI inputs but an HDMI switch fixes that right up.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Weidmann

customer_reviews.title: Great, until suddenly not
customer_reviews.text: Well, it worked fantastic and I loved it dearly, but after just over 2 years it died. I was watching a show when the backlight turned off. Every time we turn on the TV, the backlight is on for less than one second, then darkness. We tried troubleshooting and even replaced all the boards, including motherboard, t-con board, and backlight converter. The problem remained the same. We paid $800 for a TV that lasted 2 years. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Strope

customer_reviews.title: YES IT HAS HDR / 4K !
customer_reviews.text: To keep it simple, 43 inches is huge (😂). With that said does this TV have HDR, YES, 4K YES. If you’re like me and you don’t want a tv too big for gaming this is perfect. Not a bad picture At all for what you’re paying. I say go for it, no issues with shipping and the box was intact. Setting up was easy and linking your amazon and Verizon accounts were not complicated once the Tv connects to your WiFi. Download the Roku app for you specific device and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Best budget 4k set available for the price bar none.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV as a housewarming present for my daughter. The first TV arrived smashed. I contacted Amazon immediately and they sent a replacement that arrived within 3 days. The replacement TV has been excellent so far. I hooked up the TV to the internet via Ethernet and went through the process of setting her up with a Roku account. Within a few minutes she was up and running and looking at a very impressive picture. I simply cannot believe the quality of this TV set for the amount of money I paid. The TV has incredible color and is plenty bright enough for her needs. I would recommend this set to anybody looking for a new TV.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Charland

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: Almost a year later, this has been a fantastic TV. The picture and sound are great and it's super light. It's also awesome to only have one remote for power, volume, and the Roku. My only gripe is the remote but it was enough to drop this to 4 stars. It's a light, cheap-feeling, plastic and it has poor transmission (or maybe the TV's receiver has poor reception). It only works when pointed directly at the TV at a certain angle. The built-in Roku hardware is apparently a Roku Ultra but my Roku Ultra's remote is heavy and works from 20 feet away when facing in the opposite direction. It's more like the remote from the Roku Express.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Not 120hz
customer_reviews.text: Its not a true 120hz tv. It's 60hz with double frames or something like that idk it even says so on their website. Kinda shady in my opinion to advertise as 120 when it's clearly not. Wtf that was the whole reason I chose to buy this tv.
customer_reviews.author: Prebble

customer_reviews.title: Beware of "Live Pause" feature!
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint relates to what TCL calls "live pause". Live pause can be used by adding a 16GB flash drive/thumb drive (not included) to the TV and allows the user to "rewind" and pause the TV for up to 90 minutes. I am having no luck with live pause. I have used 3 different flash drives and the live pause feature continues to be "just plain flaky"! It skips, starts and stops on its own and can be quite frustrating especially when one is watching a show and suddenly the TV has advanced 15 minutes and refuses to "rewind" back to where one needs to be in one's TV show. Grrr!
customer_reviews.author: De Freev

customer_reviews.title: An excellent TV for the price you pay.  Fast startup, good picture.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a dead column. I would totally give it five stars: it's got a clear picture, it's fast enough to enjoy on movies or games, and it STARTS UP FAST (I never knew how valuable that was before). I would give it five stars if it didn't come with a dead column. Audio gives you lots of options, and although you're not going to get good bass or full-range sound out of the built-in speakers, you will definitely be impressed with the option to highlight speech (makes it easier to hear dialogue at low volume while the kids are asleep even with other stuff happening in the picture).
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fruzzetti

customer_reviews.title: Nice, thats all
customer_reviews.text: It has a nice picture and lots of apps. But sometimes, I get no volume, when I change channels. It's very sporadic and customer service never got back to me. Also, you have to scroll through the channels, as the remote has not numbers, just gigantic Netflix, Roku buttons. I considered sending it back, but wasn't worth the hassle. I can live with the audio not coming on occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Osmondite

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted about a year
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty good while it lasted. Easy to use interface, picture is fine but not great. I considered it a good deal for the money. Then the right side of the screen went dim. Customer service just had me reboot it and do a power drain, neither thing fixed the problem. I think having it repaired (if it can be) would cost as much as the TV did. Sadly, the economics of the situation says we'll just throw this TV out and buy a new one of better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Beth M

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I also own this:  The TCL brand is cheaper in price and much better. It can handle a higher refresh rate and the input lag isn't nearly as noticeable as the Samsung. It works amazing as a PC / Computer monitor. Its like having 4 1080p screens with no seams. The Roku software is a bit invasive, but can be ignored... if you use roku, its actually just fine.
customer_reviews.author: aaron ruse

customer_reviews.title: Good product but Slighty DoA
customer_reviews.text: Good product , unfortunately the item was slightly Damaged upon arrival. There are three white smudge like irrimovalable spots on the upper right side of the tv. Normally I would over look at this minor caveat , however being a broke college student this was an immense purchase, one which I saved for through the greater part of the summer. Everytime those spots catch my eyes I get depresssed. I absolutely love this tv. That's the worst part about it... Has all the lastest functions 4K. HDR ... Roku. I only wish I got one without the defective pixels or whatever those spots are.
customer_reviews.author: ACherchian

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal on a Large Smart Tv Anywhere GET THEM BEFORE THE PRICES RISE!
customer_reviews.text: This 55inch TCL tv at $329.99 2017 model year is the best large tv deal around by far. The Roku remote for using Netflix and YouTube works better than the remote that came with my 75" Samsung that I bought last year for over $2000. I bought two and I'm so glad I did. I didn't have smart tv's in my bedrooms so I wanted to update and TCL made setup with Netflix easy peasie. They were easy to mount on the wall because they're light. Good sound and picture. Maybe not the best but close enough for me. Don't let the model year bother you, these tv's are brand new and are good quality 120hz refresh rate.
customer_reviews.author: Saint Cloud FL Retiree

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a 55” TV
customer_reviews.text: I really love this TV and my family does too. The sound gets really loud, the picture is beautiful and clear, my boyfriend and my son play video games on it and they have no complaints about the picture. The only thing that is wrong is the remote just stopped working. We’ve only had the TV a few months, I changed the batteries just in case, but still isn’t working. I’m glad there are three little buttons on the bottom center of the TV for the power, volume, and menu. What a life saver. I’m hoping after reaching out, that they will resolve the issue. I will update once I reach out to them. Otherwise, great TV and great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty damn good for $350.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good picture for $350. The fact that this does 4K and streams app based videos for the price is kind of crazy. This would be a great Tv for a second room. The 4K and HDR can’t compare to the higher-end sets available and the blacks are nowhere near OLED levels, but for the bucks this is hard to beat. Video on quality on 4K streaming is quite impressive. There are a few cool options in the menu that made it easier to set up for my folks. You can tell the TV what input to default to every time you turn it on. Keep it of the super bright modes and take the sharpness for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Compton

customer_reviews.title: User Friendly
customer_reviews.text: This TV was a great purchase! I previously owned a non-smart TV, but I had a BluRay player and Fire stick connected to it. I was disappointed with the complications I had getting the Fire stick to work consistently and with certain apps, like Hulu. So I purchased this TCL smart TV and have had success from day one! It’s user friendly! The picture is crisp and vivid. I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: S. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: According to my order list, I ordered one of those TVs on April 19th 2018. Today, April 21st 2019, it doesn't even start. Just over one year. A pretty bad investment, if you ask me. Now I'm waiting to see what happens to the identical one that i bought 3 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Gui

customer_reviews.title: Other than that issue this tv is absolutely perfect! I highly recommend this brand
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this tv 5 stars but there seems to be a glitch with the Roku Netflix app. We tried erasing the app and re-downloading it with no luck. The app stalls and quits over and over. Netflix still works you just get cut off sometimes from browsing because of it. Other than that issue this tv is absolutely perfect! I highly recommend this brand. Having the built in Roku is the way to go! We love using the phone app to power on and browse when we can’t find our tv remote. Despite the app glitch, I would buy this tv again and again! Love!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Arvin

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Wow stay away. This thing worked great for 4 months. Then it turned black and never worked again. You get what you pay for. I paid 689 dollars for this thing and Amazon wouldn't refund nor the manufacturer. My fault for not buying from a normal bricks and mortar place like walmart. Sorry Amazon just telling the truth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good value
customer_reviews.text: You cant ask for much more at this price point. This has opened my eyes to the power of roku, and it's built into the tv. I use it primarily as a monitor for my pc, but also do several streaming apps (Netflix/Sunday Ticket/Fox Sports/ etc...) I don't use the audio of the display, so not sure about that performance. Picture is clear and bright with no noticeable "noise" etc.. I do see a bright "halo effect" around the edges of the screen and the buttons on the bottom are a bit of a pain. All in all, though great value. Makes me consider replacing other displays with a similar model (just bigger).
customer_reviews.author: Matt Larson

customer_reviews.title: Best TV I own
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. TV is excellent and the roku interface is easy to use. Mounts easy on the wall, I used a universal wall mount. My remote to the TV had issues with the buttons sticking within the first week of use, I had to open it up to unstick the volume button. I called TCL and they sent me a new remote, with minimal difficulties other than making the phone call. I would buy TCL again and I am secretly hoping for one of my other TVs to break so I can upgrade to another TV like this.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good price, but don't expect a quality 4k image
customer_reviews.text: Great price and exactly what I wanted, but I'm very disappointed in the picture quality. The picture is too bright even at the dimmest setting. The images really show any and all compression artifacts. Other TVs seem to mask or filter much more of this noise out, but the TCLs bright screen enhances it. As it is, I can't use it in the bedroom where I planned to place it, because of the brightness and I couldn't put it as my movie TV because of the poor picture quality. I wanted to send it back, but that is a hassle, so I set it up as the kids TV.
customer_reviews.author: tdg

customer_reviews.title: LOVE MY TCL ROKU HDR HD TV!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am in heaven. Wow. What a great TV. I was a little apprehensive about the set-up. But when it arrived l just got busy unpacking it and hoped for the best. It was a breeze to set up and get my apps logged into Roku and a few minor adjustments to the picture and l was set. Spectacular color and the sound quality is off the charts. Why would anyone need better sound? For my budget this TCL HDR TV is the bomb. Don't be fooled by all the high class brands and perks they advertise to reel in your dollars, this TV can compete with them all. Legit.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki S.

customer_reviews.title: ranging from having some fine black levels to mottled if flat greys are displayed
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. In this case, though, I was pleasantly surprised, particularly by the 4K HDR quality. The full complement of Roku apps and options are here, though some options must be accessed through a mobile app, which I thought was an odd decision. The backlight is of middling quality, ranging from having some fine black levels to mottled if flat greys are displayed. This unit doesn’t support Dolby Vision, either, so you may want to opt for the pricier P series version (which, if you’ve got the cash, is a good idea).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great TV but only 3 HDMI inputs, if that’s important
customer_reviews.text: This tv replases a TCL 32 inch that continues to turn out 720p video after 8 years in service. The TCL 43S405 is an excellent replacement:high resolution, good color, and the Roku feature, which is just fine. I don’t use it because my Fire TV stick supplies Bluetooth for headphone use. I have a pc hooked up to one of the 3 HDMI inputs, the Fire TV, and a PS4, which looks nice. The $300 dollar cost is less than what I paid for the older TV eight years ago. So far, I’m really satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zardoz

customer_reviews.title: Good deal, slim design picture is good.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second TCL and I gladly purchased it as a smart TV this time. The price was definitely reasonable. The design for the base has plastic feet easy to put together but if I were to move I would definitely remove them as they don't seem sturdy if they got bumped around. Otherwise, great buy. I don't need top of the line TV. I had the other TCL for 7 years and it began to have black lines through it. Subtle, and I probably would have just dealt with it but just looking I saw this price and decided to go ahead and upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: We bought this TV about a year and a half and really liked it until a couple of days ago. My husband was watching a movie and out of nowhere the TV goes black. There is audio but no picture. We tried resetting the TV, unplugging and plugging it back in. WE looked for troubleshooting on line. And that is when we discovered this is a common problem and there really is no easy fix. So now we either have to pay to get this TV fixed, which will probably cost more than we paid for the TV (and that's if it can be fixed) or we buy a new TV. I don't think we will be buying another TCL.
customer_reviews.author: Peachdkg

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use esp
customer_reviews.text: Large, bright, clear picture. Very easy to use esp. with Roku built in. We hook inour own Edifier speakers, so can’t comment on the tv speakers. So much cheaper than higher rated sets, but so far (only one month) we’re not missing a thing. Unrelated pet peeve: Why do so many people submit answers to customer product questions along the lines of “I don’t know the answer to your question.”? If you don’t know the answer to a question, why bother taking up space saying so?
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k monitor for my PC at a very cheap price
customer_reviews.text: I am using it as a monitor for my PC. It works great at 4k 60Hz for both gaming and desktop usage. My graphic card (AMD Radeon R9 390) couldn't get past 4k 30Hz with just an HDMI cable (it is an issue of the graphic card, not the TV), so I bought aand it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo Prosperi

customer_reviews.title: A great value buy, solid option on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Maaaannn, I love this TV. The ROKU embedded interface is super user friendly. The remote has a Netflix and Hulu direct buttons so I can jump straight to my app without looking for it. You can download apps like Fox Sports (used it to stream the World Cup games). Great TV for the price. Even the sound is pretty good, don’t think i need extra speakers / sound system
customer_reviews.author: Saman E.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice TV for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice TV for the price, the only reason it does not have 5 stars is the sound is pretty tinny For the price I will not complain and the picture is very good. I have a sound bar hooked up to it for those times when I care about the sound. I would buy again even with the sound lacking a bit as that is easily compensated for.
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase! Very easy to set up and exceptional picture. The Roku and 4K are awesome. Great TV for the price. UPDATE TO REVIEW. After about a year, there is now a line that travels up the screen, most noticed in darker screens. TV still works, however, disappointed that was only good for a year or so UPDATE TO THE UPDATE. TV now cannot be used without annoyance. Line traveling up now takes up the majority of the screen. Terrible TV
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this TV for the price. Bought this for my man cave to be able to kick back with a beer and watch the hockey games. Following the luck is very easy, picture is very fluid. Picture and audio quality is fantastic. The controls and settings are very easy to understand. The zoom feature is also nice for gaming. I play my old 8/16 bit games on it and they look fantastic. My only complaint is it doesn't have component jacks, which really isn't that bad. This will def be a go to TV when the other tvs in the house start dieing off.
customer_reviews.author: GobblinFool

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price. I don't have much 4K content, but when I can play it you can tell it's higher res. The color depth is what the biggest effect for me is. Seems well built, and an easy to use remote. My Xbox One S detected it was a 4K TV and took me to the settings to make sure I was set up correctly as well. No problems at all recommending this TV especially at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: Overall great tv. Just one little quirk
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this tv. Every once in a while when I turn it on, the screen stays black. I can tell the tv is on, as there is sound, but the screen will be black. I have to turn the tv off and walk away for a few hours. When I come back it turns on without a problem. I’ve had this happen maybe 10 times over the last year or so we’ve had the tv. It’s a little annoying, but that’s the only little quirk I’ve noticed. Otherwise, the picture quality is good and the smart features are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Stack

customer_reviews.title: Dead right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Tv was defective right out of the box. When turned on it had a black screen with white lines. Reading about some other tv’s it seems to be a problem across the board. I think a lot of this damage is caused by a rough ride across the Pacific. No problem returning it. 1 star for the tv, 5 stars for Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stase

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: 1.The first, and IMO, the most important thing is the picture quality. When you are directly in front of the tv, or slightly to the side, the picture is very good. However, from a moderate angle, the picture quality greatly diminishes. 2. The factory sound quality is good, relatively speaking. 3. The roku remote is user friendly, except for the fact that there is no number keypad which is a bit inconvenient. i do like it for the smart tv, though. Overall, I give this tv 3 1/2 out of five stars
customer_reviews.author: GJD

customer_reviews.title: Forget Sony or Samsung, TCL is same or better at 1/3 price
customer_reviews.text: Disclosure, my previous TV was a 42 in Plasma from 2010. With that said this television is absolutely terrific. The integrated Roku is easy to set up and can stream media from my Samba server. The Roku app for Android turns any Android device into a remote for the television. Netflix YouTube and Amazon Prime all work natively and it is great. I ended up wall mounting the TV using one of those suggested mounts below. Definitely recommend that route for the 55in TV Television is well-made picture is very clear I tested it with 1080P and 4K sample media from YouTube. Definitely worth the money, you are getting more than what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: N. M. S.

customer_reviews.title: After owning it for 2 years...
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned this TV for 2 years and there is nothing I don't like about it except maybe it's speaker, but I have a Bose Solo 15 Series II TV Sound System so I don't care about that. I love the Roku home menu where I can choose from my Cable, Apple TV or DVD player, besides having apps for Netflix, YouTube, Amazon Prime, MLB TV, Weather Nation, most news outlets, and more. No technical issues and my mother watches it practically non-stop since we purchased it in Dec 2017. If I ever get another TV, I will definitely look at TCL again.
customer_reviews.author: BridgeDT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value, love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent TV for the price! Very easy to set up, has a ton of easy-to-use features and a nice, crisp image. I hooked it up to an indoor digital antenna and get 20+ free channels. The free trials for Netflix, Sling, etc. are a nice bonus. I wasn't home when it was delivered, but the delivery driver brought around to my back door instead of leaving this huge TV on front porch to tempt passersby -- very pleased with Amazon's delivery service for this TV as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie A

customer_reviews.title: Sound Stinks
customer_reviews.text: First one delivered died after a month. Repairman says they don't even bother to try to fix, they just throw them away. Screen is plastic, not glass. Second tv works fine and the Roku functionality is fine as well. HOWEVER, speakers are backwards facing and really poor. We literally can't hear the dialogue on shows and now use subtitles just so we can follow. I know the price on this is tempting, but I suggest you go with something else unless you've got surround sound already.
customer_reviews.author: TertiumQuid

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 4K TV On A Budget
customer_reviews.text: This 55" 4K smart TV cost me only $359 because it's last year's model, but picture quality is as crisp, sharp, and detailed as brands that cost 2-3 times that. Highly recommend leaving the brightness to the normal setting...if you turn up the brightness detail gets washed out. Only drawback is this 2017 model doesn't connect to Bluetooth speakers...yes, not user error, several online forums confirm the TCL model doesn't connect to Bluetooth speakers. So, get a digital or headphone cable to connect to external speakers or soundbar. Aside from that, I'm very happy with this purchase. Been using this TV for 3 months and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gr8ful

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't connect to internet well
customer_reviews.text: This thing clearly does not connect to the internet very well, which is a huge problem for a smart TV. I previously was using an older TV with a BluRay player for Netflix, Hulu, etc. and it worked great with my high speed internet, but this TV does not keep a solid connection and buffers a lot. I don't really know what to do now that I'm stuck with it, but I'm definitely not happy with the purchase. I would look for a different TV.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: No regrets on this Television purchase
customer_reviews.text: One feature that I did not see mentioned that I personally like, is that you can record (for instant playback) up to 90 minutes on the input that is connected to the coax connection. This is convenient so that if get interrupted while watching a program, you can rewind to see what you missed. Great picture quality, audio is very clear. Lots of hdmi ports, and inputs for older vcr players. Great value compared to Samsung and LG models. Definitely would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and is by far the best smart TV experience
customer_reviews.text: This TV was an incredible value. The Roku interface is perfectly integrated, and is by far the best smart TV experience. I was concerned about buying TCL due to some of these reviews. I bought a 55" and 43" 4K TV. The image quality is great. Sound is very good. The stands work well and are stable. Even though I also have a 75" LG 4KTV, if I had to do it over again, I'd buy TCL. It is a great TV period. For the price it is simple awesome value. You don't need anything more.
customer_reviews.author: baron95

customer_reviews.title: ... last or live up to the hype or the bad ratings. Easy setup great picture and sound
customer_reviews.text: Another desperate search and all the various ratings not knowing if the purchase will last or live up to the hype or the bad ratings. Easy setup great picture and sound. Only caution is the bottom of the carton was open. Not sure how the item did not slip out other than the coefficient of friction kept it from sliding out. The delivery person did invert the carton at my door step so that would not happen. Surprised the bottom was not stapled or tape closed. The adhesive somehow let go and the flaps were open.
customer_reviews.author: Swede

customer_reviews.title: So much TV for the price.
customer_reviews.text: TV is awesome for what you pay. The only 2 gripes I have are the viewing angle sorta sucks. I can live with that for the price though. The one thing I wish the engineers would add though is volume normalization. Some commercials on some content providers are still RIDICULOUSLY loud. I'm sure this would be a super easy thing to add via a software update and it would improve the viewing experience of so many owners.
customer_reviews.author: LAZZZERS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: In short this tv is a pleasant surprise. Pretty reasonable price. The important thing.... this has a good picture it also passes throug good audio to a home theater...”atmos” and all the other Digital sound nessary for quality home theater. This is affectively a top quality roku plus a great tv all in one! Update I’ve had this tv for about 4 months now. I’ve been pretty happy until now. I went to play a movie on vudu yesterday and the audio “Dolby atmos” will not play. I watch the same movie through my roku 4 and it works great. Having a tv for just 4 months and now the audio is not working! Not cool !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TCL has great customer service & great products!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with my new TCL 4k Roku Smart TV. It has served me well, and with any little issue I've had, TCL was quick to help me. One issue I had with the TV screen showing a line through it shortly after purchasing the TV, TCL was quick to send me a return box for returning the TV. Within 3 days, I had a replacement TV (new). Thanks TCL!
customer_reviews.author: Regi254

customer_reviews.title: Great TV! I'm not TV critic or anything but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great TV! I'm not TV critic or anything but to me the picture is great. I'm not a fan of the random movie "ad" on the main menu screen and haven't found a way to fully get rid of that just yet. But that's the only complaint I have. Smart TV works great, simple to operate and connected to our media streaming without issues. Has a number of free movie apps (with commercials but hey it's free movies like on netflix so they have to pay for those somehow). I play Destiny on it and it looks great, no noticeable lag time. I've played a number of other games without issues as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wraith7n

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk and no Customer service
customer_reviews.text: We purchased three TCL TV's. One died after less than 20hrs of viewing and a week out of the box and another less than two years the screens stopped working. We emailed customer service and they replied with a standard form letter essentially saying too bad, we don't care, case closed. We still have one but have replaced the others with insignia fire and the picture and sound quality and the insignia is far superior to TCL. Spend your money elsewhere. Absolute junk with no customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. Great TV
customer_reviews.text: This TV works for me. I got the 43 inch which is a perfect size for me, as it is easy to move by myself. Video gaming is excellent on it. I like the ROKU feature. Its very fast and simple to use. The picture is very good. I use exterior speakers through the optical out. It The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that there is no web browser on a ROKU, but I have computers for that so its not really a negative. .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A.

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: Utterly disappointing. I didn't realize that the HDR is only 8 bit versus 10 (something the product page doesn't feel neccesary to mention), resulting in a washed out image when trying to utilize HDR on PS4. I don't understand including such half-implemented technology, unless, of course, your business model is make cheap items to dupe those on a budget. You're absolutely getting what you pay for here. If it wasn't my own fault for not researching this thoroughly enough, being woefully uneducated about television display technology, I'd return it. Spend the extra money, and get a better set. This garbarge is probably harvesting all your data anyway.
customer_reviews.author: foxstomp

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and features!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and features for the price. The Roku apps are awesome and you don’t need another device like Apple TV. I have an Apple TV but no longer use it because this TV has all the features and apps that an Apple TV has. The picture and sound quality is awesome. The only down side is that the volume button on the remote is not working well. You have to press hard. However, there is a remote app that allows you control your tv on your smartphone. In overall I’m very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Murat

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first 4k TV, also my first Roku. The TV is great. The Roku service is whatever. The mobile app that doubles as a remote is awesome though. Picture quality is good. Sound quality is, as you would expect through TV speakers, mediocre. But hooked up through a receiver or console it is fine. I really can't complain about this TV at all. It's responsive. The picture quality is good, HDR is good, upscaling is good. You can barely tell the difference between the upscaled PS4 graphics upscaled by the TV and the upscaled graphics from the Xbox One-S. Totally happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. Allsup

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: While there is a little bit of a learning curve in terms of using Roku as the TV's operating system, this is a pretty great TV for an attractive price. TCL does a great job of packaging the unit (which means it would arrive in perfect condition) and setup is quick and easy. Picture quality seems great to me, and although we have a sound bar/subwoofer combination, the TV's audio quality is pretty good on its own. It also is doing a better job of pulling in over-the-air stations than that of our previous TV. I suppose some technophiles could find something lacking in this TV, but for the average viewer, TCL TV's seem like a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Moom

customer_reviews.title: This initially seems to be a very good value. The picture quality is exceptional and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Black Friday promotion. Shipment was approximately 1 week beyond the initial promise. My first TV in 6 years and the upgraded, double boxed, shipping is a step up. This initially seems to be a very good value. The picture quality is exceptional and the integrated Roku application works great. Easy setup for antenna, satellite and internet inputs. Synced perfectly with my existing Roku account. The ultimate test of the set will be it's long term durability, but I am initially quite impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Spanman

product_meta.title: TCL 49" Class 4-Series 4K UHD HDR Roku 2017 Smart TV - 49S405
product_meta.description:
Size:49 Inch| Configuration:TV only

TCL, one of the world's largest TV manufacturers in the world and America’s fastest growing TV brand, bring the latest in 4K technology and design. With HRD compatibility, choose from more than 4,000 streaming channels that feature 450,000 movies and TV episodes plus live sports, news, music, kids and family, food, science and tech, fitness, foreign language and so much more.

One cool feature if you're doing this, is that you can program the TV to, instead of turning on to the home screen, when you power it up, it will go directly to one of those sources if you wish.



The digital optical audio output is one of three audio connections to get sound external sources. The others being HDMI ARC, and an analog audio output in the form of a 3.5 mm audio jack. It also works perfectily with gaming devices, with the combination of 4K ultra HD, HDR support, a dedicated gaming mode, and amazingly low input lag, this is one of the best reviewed gaming TVs of the year!
